headline: Chicken Enchiladas with Cream of Chicken Soup
description: This chicken enchilada recipe with cream of chicken soup is quick and easy with simple, flavorful ingredients — baked together in cheesy perfection.
name: Chicken Enchiladas with Cream of Chicken Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix soup and sour cream in a small bowl; set aside.

Melt margarine in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and chili powder, and sauté until tender. Stir in chicken, chile peppers, and 2 tablespoons of the soup mixture. Cook and stir until heated through.

Spread 1/2 cup of the soup mixture in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla. Roll up tortillas and place, seam-sides-down, in the baking dish. Spoon remaining soup mixture on top, and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I like this recipe. I have made this several times but as I live alone, I make a half batch. This last time my oven controller is bad and I finished it in my air fryer at 315*F. I plate it with medium salsa and sriracha for a little heat and of course, tortilla chips.
good and mild

I used a can of diced tomatoes with green chili's instead of the green chili's, and added some red pepper flakes and a bit of hot sauce and garlic. I also included a can of red enchilada sauce to the left over mixture before pouring over the top.
Made this for dinner today, delicous!

I followed the recipe closely but with a few minor changes. I used corn tortillas instead to keep it more traditional. Left over filling i put on top of tortillas. Finished it off topping with a medium enchilada sauce. Delicious.
Yum!
So simple and delicious. I added some beans to the recipe.

Easy, Tasty, Inexpensive, Fast. What more could you want?! Only changes I made: Used roasted Costco chicken (shredded meat), sprinkled hot taco seasoning on top (as others suggested) and 7 oz can of green chili’s (we like them a lot).
Used santafe seasoning and chilli powder, cream of chicken and cream of celery soup, 1 can green chillis , chicken breast made on stove with seasoning
Love this! I added sliced black olives and omitted the onion & butter. I also used 1/2 pkg of taco seasoning instead of the chili powder. Turned out great!
Great!! Loved by my family, a little more effort involved, but it was my very first time trying to make Enchiladas and I did it!! Yay!
Added a little bit more chicken and sour cream

This has become a frequent flyer in our house of fussy kid eaters. I find it's easier to buy a disposable aluminum pan and double the recipe; much easier clean up. The left overs travel well for the next day lunches as well.
Great quick dinner for the fams. I substituted queso cheese for the sour cream. Doubled the sauce, and added black beans....VERY GOOD

The idea is ok. Definitely not spicy. Pretty bland actually.
These are the alterations I would make if I were two make it again:
-add more soup mixture to the filling
-add cheese to the filling
-add jalapenos
-add a little milk to the soup mixture (so it's not so thick- maybe a couple tablespoons) after you add it to the chicken
-way more cheese on top

We don't eat meat so I used Quorn brand turkey loaf and Cream of Mushroom soup.
My family really enjoys this recipe using ground turkey or beef. I still use the cream of chicken regardless of the meat I use in my recipe. Thanks for sharing it.

I make this all of the time. My family loves. If I don’t have enough time or no tortillas on hand, I just crunch tortilla chips in bottom of pan, pour whole mixture on top, sprinkle with cheese and bake as calls for.
This was delicious! Only change I made was to use corn tortillas. (just my preference)

I don’t normally like enchiladas, even tho I love Mexican food. For reason this recipe appealed to me so decided to make on a whim. I did make some additions because we like our food spicy. I added a can of medium enchilada sauce to the cream of chicken/sour cream mixture. Then, I used hot green chilies and added 1 tsp of cumin to the onion mixture. I used Monterey jack cheese to top it all off. I baked the casserole covered in foil for 30 minutes, then uncovered for 10 more to brown the cheese. It was excellent and I will definitely make again!
I lightly warmed the flour tortillas so as to not crack/break after filling when folding them up. Also added to topping sliced green onions and black Olives.
This worked out perfect I did the chili powder and chicken and green Chile's and onion together, I also added a pinch of chili powder the soup amd spur cream mix
I’ve been making this for years!! My family loves it.

Great way to use leftover rotisserie chicken!! Time-saver tip.. skip the roll-up and just layer the tortillas with ingredients. Like previous reviewers - Extra spice, sauce, veggies and cheese make this a keeper. Be creative - you really can't go wrong with this one !!
Very tasty. First time made as direct and it was great. Second time I used cream cheese in place of sour cream as a substitute. It gave it a richer flavor. Either way is great.

New Favorite in this house !!! Big Hit with just a couple alterations- small can green chiles , added can of rotel tomatoes, also added to shredded cheddar 1/2 c shredded Mexican mixture cheese —served with refried beans and rice and ta Da !! Added to menu for this family ! Even my picky hubby , not too spicy mom and brother in law who is recent addition to household ! Yes
This really is a simple and very good recipe. It has become one of our families regular rotations. I use left over rotisserie chicken when possible.
I love it. Was so easy to make . I added 1/2 can of rotel drained and put 1/2 of the cheese in with chicken mixture. It was great tsk for sharing,
I made this last night for dinner! I did add about a half cup of chopped red peppers and used a large onion. Everyone loved it!
Yummy! I added 1 cup of enchilada sauce in the mix and then covered the top of the enchiladas with the enchilada sauce and then cheese!
Delicious and only made a few personal preference modifications but great recipe
Bland! This is the first time I've disagreed with the reviews of such a highly rated recipe. I won't make again.
family loved them.
These were very good bur sauce did dry up during baking

I did not use half the soup mixture on the bottom and used mild taco seasoning mix instead of chili powder. You need all the soup mixture for spreading over the top. I served with Trader Joe’s Cowboy Caviar. It was very good and will make again!

Excellent dish! We used it for a big family lunch and everyone (except the picky kiddos) enjoyed it. We added a little extra milk and sour cream to the soup because we made 2 pans. But I would say use the recipe for a base and make them as juicy or dry as you prefer. Will definitely make these again, thanks for the recipe :)

Used this as basis. Added rotel tomatoes with chilies to soup and sour cream. Added 4 Tbls of taco sauce and chili powder. Added sautéed poblano, 1/2 cup of green,yellow and orange peppers, 3/4 cup of diced red onion. Filled tortilla wraps with mixture( using it all). Added cheese to filling. Poured can of red enchilada sauce over top. Sprinkled with green onion, cheddar and spicy pepper jack cheeses. EXCELLENT!!

Incase my last 3 review didn’t take .... recipe was awesome! Took advise from jennyb1234567.... needs a little extra green chili salsa and highly recommend the cheese soup can... will definitely make again!

This is the perfect recipe to modify a little here or there for different ocassions and people. My kids love this recipe as is. I threw in some extra seasoning an jalepenos for my husband and me and it was terrific. It's one to try and keep.
This recipe was very good. The only change I made was to add some grated cheddar cheese to the filling.

This recipe is really easy! I used a can of medium heat hatch green chillies and used the Mexican Style shredded cheese instead of cheddar. Those were the only changes I made and it was fantastic. My husband couldn't get enough and he complimented them over and over. I'll definitely make these again and again.

This was SO YUMMY!! I’m already planning on making it again this weekend. I added green enchilada sauce to the soup & sour cream, added more mixture to the chicken filling to make it more moist, & substituted the chili powder for taco seasoning. I used peppers, onion, & chicken for the filling. Perfect amount of spice! I topped with green onions & guacamole.

Pretty good! I agree with adding a little of the soup mixture to the chicken. I only used 7 of the tortillas and used a 11 x 7 dish. I used a can of rotels and had 4 cups of chicken; still didn't need the 9 x 12 dish. Hope this helps!
Nice flavor! I doubled the recipe for the sauce using 1 can each of Cream of Mushroom and Cream of Chicken; and used all of a 7oz can of green chilis. Next time I will use a little more chicken.

The chicken mixture was amazing! Although the tortillas were super gooey and mushy, kinda like playdough, so we had to eat the chicken mixture out of it. Not sure if it was the kind of tortillas I had or if the soup made it mushy. Willing to try this recipe again though just because of the chicken!

I followed the recipe pretty much. But I did use can chicken. 
Wow easy and so good.
Very tasty and easy. Will make again.
Delicious! I made the recipe just as is and it was wonderful. Next time, I might thin the sauce a bit with green enchilada sauce just to give it a bit more liquid; however it was great as is.
Very easy to make and enough leftover for munch the next day.
Very easy to make and enough leftover for munch the next day.
I didn’t think this recipe could be better than my original, but I was pleasantly surprised. The family couldn’t get enough of them and the request is in for next week! Great, delicious enchiladas!
This a favorite for dinner. This is my third time making it. I used cream of mushroom instead of cream of chicken this time and turned out great!
Really enjoyed this recipe, but followed what Bobbesong did to the recipe in the reviews.
I made dish back in January. I used canned chicken and it was delicious.
Not into extreme spices but the soup as the sauce was delicious. Stayed very moist!
This is a go to recipe in our kitchen! I keep tortillas in the frig and usually have everything else on hand. This is so GOOD when you change it out for shrimp too!
Amazing!!!

This was a hit and no leftovers!

I had just the right amount of leftover rotisserie chicken and so glad I made this recipe.

I did add some extra cumin and some smoked paprika. My husband doesn't like too much heat so I used just one canned whole Hatch Chili, which gave the perfect zing.

I did as someone suggested, and heated the tortillas in the oven wrapped in foil for a a few minutes which made them more pliable. I didn't want too much extra tortilla -to-meat-ratio, so I cut off about 1 1/2" off one side of the tortilla. That is the side that I folded in first to hold the meat in. It was easier to roll up this way, too.

I added some jarred Penzey's Taco seasoning (it is like a thick sauce) to taste in the sour cream and soup mixture for extra flavor. I served the enchiladas with Salsa Verde (i.e. green salsa) on the side.

I will definitely make this again!

As others have mentioned there isn't enough sauce for the recipe. The first time I made this I followed the recipe but added extra sauce to the chicken mixture and the second time I made it I doubled the sauce and the amount of chilis. I put more of the chicken in each enchilada and they turned out amazing!
Very good recipe. I doubled the chicken and added diced tomatoes and hot pepper flakes but otherwise followed the recipe.
Loved it and so did my family. I substituted creamed corn for the cream
pretty dang tasty! I added a little milk to the soup/sour creme . very moist and will make again.
Used cream of chicken soup. Spread a little filling in bottom of pan before putting filled enchiladas down. Used eight 8” tortillas and it fit perfectly.
This recipe was ok, a little too rich with the canned soup. I added taco seasoning to the chicken and shredded jack cheese to the chicken filling.

Gygghhggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggghggghggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggghhggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggyggggggggggggggghhgggggggggggggggggggghggggggggggggggghyhgggggggghygggggghggggggggggggggggghghghgh
This was super easy and tasted great. I made a few adjustments, I added a can of Rotel which i put in blender to puree slightly and then added to mixture in pan prior to adding chicken.
After reading all of the positive reviews, I was excited to serve this for dinner. We all agreed it's totally bland. I think it's a good base recipe one could spice up though.

OMG this is the bomb recipe. I normally do not alter recipes as written, but after viewing the rave reviews of this recipe, I spiced it up a bit as others mentioned using the chili powder, taco seasoning and diced up jalapenos inside each enchilada (yes my family does like it spicy). I additionally doubled the sauce as was just perfect. Thank you for your recipe, it was a high hit with my family. I know this will be my go to recipe for chicken enchiladas.

I made this recipe exactly how it reads with the only swap being real butter for margarine. I made it earlier in the afternoon for dinner the same night which made for an easy dinner. 

Overall, it was a great recipe. My hubs and I both really enjoyed it and I now have another yummy dinner to add to my dinner rotation. Two thumbs up!
I made this using dairy free items and I can tell it would have been delicious the real way.
My husband LOVED it. I used taco seasoning instead of other seasonings. I also used Rotelle instead of green chilies. It’s was very good!

made this plenty of times! my parents neighbors even asked for the recipe. so i shared this one. typically i go off of this recipe & do my own thing with it. mainly adding red enchilada sauce (on the bottom of the baking dish & on top of the rolled uncooked enchiladas) & veggies. diced up peppers & onion. 3rd time making this i added black beans to it. so good!! doubling up the recipe from now on since everyone loves it fresh & as leftovers!
I Added a can on diced tomatoes with green Chile's instead of just the Chile's.
Just use corn tortillas instead and it’s perfect !!
Easy and very tasty. The entire family liked it.
Eh, they aren't bad per se. they taste like chicken soup, not enchiladas.
Good, but I wasn't exactly blown away by it

I made a few changes that have made a world of difference: 
1) I use rotisserie chicken
2) I mix one can of soup and one can of MILK instead of sour cream over medium heat until combined and sauce like. 
3) Instead of adding chiles, I put pepper jack cheese inside the tortilla and cheddar on top.

This is an awesome recipe....it’s definitely a keeper. I made my chicken in the crock pot with alittle bit of jalapeño juice and a tablespoon of taco seasoning and then shredded the chicken when it was done. I did double the sauce and added some jalapeño juice for some spice. It’s an easy and delicious recipe!
I have made this recipe many times, and it's a WINNER! I've even made it in my large electric skillet with success. Suggest lower temp for that. About 275.

My husband raved over these enchiladas. I only gave them 4 stars because my true enchilada loves are made with corn tortillas which aren’t American main stream. This is what I did to add to the existing recipe. I doubled the soup/sour cream sauce mixture (using 1 can cream of chicken and 1 can of green enchilada sauce, both 10 oz). I also used a 2 cup cheese bag of shredded cheddar. I used 16oz pack of seasoned shredded chicken (this cut down on a ton of time). I also seasoned with about 1 tbsp cumin. I added an additional 1 cup of the soup mixture in the chicken to give it more moisture when laying into the tortillas. Served it with my Spanish rice and refried black beans topped with cojita (white crumbly Spanish cheese) or similar type cheese on top. Yummy!
Great recipe!!! We doubled the green Chile peppers. Definitely will make again. There were no left overs
I made this tonight and it was very good. I followed advice of others and added cumin, garlic powder and Rotelle.
excellent QUICK MEAL..... Hit the spot for me
These are incredible. I make them frequently and everyone who tries them, loves them. I usually do a double batch and individually wrap them in foil and freeze them. They reheat really well!
Just added sour cream and all the fixings
I've made this recipe so many times I know it by heart, and always comes out perfect.
Definitely will make again..we added an extra 4 oz. Can of the green chilis....and topped with black olive slices.

This came out great! I added green onions and cilantro and put some red ranchero sauce and cheese on top. I also added taco seasoning to the chicken meat. Everyone said it was the best enchiladas they ever had!
I followed the recipe exactly. It had a very rich, slightly sweet taste. I can only assume the taste was due to the sour cream. If I make this again, I will use less sour cream.

It’s an ooey gooey American casserole, and quite a tasty one. It is perfectly designed to make use of leftover poultry in the refrigerator that becomes magically rehydrated and tasty. I use reduced sodium cream of chicken soup and put a tiny sprinkle of Lawtys on the onion while it sautées, otherwise the dish can easily become too salty. Really nice recipe.
My favorite chicken enchilada recipe!

This is a good go to recipe on a weeknight. I use taco seasoning instead of chili powder. I also add a cheese sauce like queso or regular Velveeta to soup mixture. I also add cheese before I roll each one. So good!
It was wonderful!!! Making it again, for sure!!!
Fast and easy,but added half a pouch of taco seasoning hot and spicy and half tsp madras curry spice.great recipe,will make it again.

My family liked this dish, I had four cups of left over chicken that I wanted to use up so I added an additional can of soup ......... Cream of Cheddar. Since the volume was larger, I decided to layer this dish especially since all the tortillas I had were corn and wouldn't be getting soggy. It was more like a Mexican Lasagna. I doubled the chili powder, added a tablespoon of cumin and Mexican oregano. I also added a small can of sliced olives, a handful of chopped dried scallions and one chopped tomato ( I soaked up most of the runny juice with paper towels, and spread them over the top of the casserole with the shredded cheese). This casserole made enough for four hungry people (adults) to finish or enough for 6-8 sides if your serving other dishes or desserts. I did serve this with sour creme, salsa and guacamole. Four adults eat every morsel! 
I do notice on All Recipes that a lot of people complain about blandness of some of the recipes, you have to remember that these are all BASE recipes and that every recipe is open for you to make "your own to suit". I myself have been know to take a 3 star and "make it my own" until I consider it a 5 star! Try it, you'll be much happier with All Recipes in the future!

I've lived in the SW US most of my life, and rarely if ever have I ever had any kind of enchiladas from a Mexican restaurant made with flour tortillas. When I decided to try to make my own, I was surprised that most of these enchilada recipes use flour tortillas - and, I've made a few of these recipes, AND, without fail every time I have used flour, they are always soggy! The filling makes the bottoms wet and sticky, and for leftovers, forget it! So, I decided to make my variation using this recipe as a filling (VERY good!), but using CORN tortillas, like the restaurants do. Dipped each tortilla in red enchilada sauce well, filled with this recipe's filling, rolled and put in lightly sprayed glass 9X13, then topped off all of them with rest of the soup/sour cream mix per this recipe; further, poured thick dribble of red enchilada sauce over entire pan of food, topped with healthy dose of shredded cheese- trying to be as short as I can here. Turned out WONDERFUL!!! I did add fresh roasted green chili from New Mexico to the filling - just my preference. I'd HIGHLY recommend trying the corn tortillas by dipping them well in the sauce, fill, etc. Sorry so long.

I used a can of condensed cheddar cheese soup instead, added a can of salsa with chilies as well, and shredded the chicken, but the chicken came out dry and the wraps soggy. Kinda the opposite of what I wanted to happen.
This was great! I personally don’t like sour cream so I didn’t use any and I used more of the soup on the inside and added some red enchilada sauce ???? perfect!

I added this to my cart without really looking at the ingredients. I think this recipe, as is, seems half completed. But I added to it and the finished result was great! I mixed the soup and sour cream before realizing it needed some finishing touches. Because I had already mixed the entire amount I ended up adding 2 whole jars of green salsa to the mix to make it flavorful and give it a little kick. I then sautéed the onions in a little extra butter and added the chicken UNCOOKED. I cooked the chicken and seasoned to taste with garlic powder, hot chili powder, cumin, cayenne, and then added the can of green chilies. I then mixed a bit of cheese into the chicken mix before rolling, coating in the sauce mix, adding a layer of cheese, and then baking. I did NOT need to add any of the sauce to the filling since I cooked it together the chicken stated very moist. It would have been way too wet with sauce inside. Spray the bottom of the baking dish with cooking spray, do not put sauce in the bottom unless it is a very tiny bit. It takes nothing for them to become very soggy on the bottom.

item.name: Chicken Enchiladas with Cream of Chicken Soup
